ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is mainly for people who are interested in advanced particle physics, particularly the theoretical side. It is a very intense course, though rewarding if you do all the work. If you are seriously interested in this topic then take it, otherwise auditing may be advised.
I would recommend this course, it is something every physicist should know something about. I would also suggest to take at most one other course at the same time.
I would say yes, take the course, but don't let the material intimidate you. I do think that it is very important to take since so much of modern physics is based on field theory.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: As a particle experimentalist, there were certainly lectures that were heavily relevant to work i am doing that may go towards my thesis. Much of the theory taught in this course will probably not be too useful though.

As of right now, I am not using anything from the course, but I am interested in particle experiment and particularly dark matter experiment and in the design of future experiments I think it will be very useful. I also believe that any good experimentalist should have a strong handle of the theory behind the experiment.In summary, I left the course feeling that I had put a lot into it and gotten a lot out of it, but I do think I have a lot of gaps in my understanding, and I am very motivated to go back and rework through some of the text.
